SWD Utility Functions
utils

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides Serial Wire Debug utilities for Ambiq Micro devices. It enables debug interface configuration, communication, and control for development and debugging applications. The utilities support SWD protocol operations and debug access port management.

Key Features

  1. Bit-Bang Communication: Direct GPIO control for SWD protocol.
  2. Memory Access: Read/write operations to target device memory.
  3. Register Access: Core register read/write capabilities.
  4. Debug Control: Halt, run, and status monitoring functions.
  5. Error Handling: Comprehensive error detection and recovery.
  6. Connection Management: SWD connection establishment and maintenance.

Functionality

  • Initialize and configure SWD communication interface
  • Establish connection with target device
  • Perform memory read/write operations (8-bit and 32-bit)
  • Access core registers for debugging
  • Control target execution (halt, run, status check)
  • Handle SWD protocol timing and signal management
  • Provide error detection and recovery mechanisms
  • Support multiple Apollo device families

Usage

  1. Initialize SWD interface using am_util_swd_initialize()
  2. Connect to target device with am_util_swd_connect()
  3. Perform debug operations (halt, run, memory access)
  4. Access registers using am_util_swd_reg_read/write()
  5. Read/write memory using am_util_swd_mem_read/write()

Configuration

  • SWD Pins: Configurable SWDIO and SWCLK pin assignments
  • Device Support: Apollo3, Apollo4, Apollo5 family compatibility
  • Memory Pools: Configurable buffer sizes for data transfer
  • Error Handling: Optional halt-on-error functionality
  • Timing Control: Adjustable clock delays for signal integrity

◆ IDLE_LOW

◆ SWDCLK_HALF_CLOCK

#define SWDCLK_HALF_CLOCK   1

By default we want to use internal logging mechanisms. It is possible however to use target program mechanisms to log messages. In order to correctly parse variable number of arguments we need to use dedicated libswd_log_internal_va() function...

◆ libswd_log_level_inherit()

int libswd_log_level_inherit ( libswd_ctx_t * libswdctx,
int loglevel )

Set debug level according to caller's application settings. \params *libswdctx swd context to work on. \params loglevel caller's application log level to be converted.

Returns
LIBSWD_OK on success, of error code on failure.
